sentences.sContent: the most expensive restaurant in town
Petrol is becoming more and more expensive.

sentences.sCn: 摄影是一项很花钱的业余爱好。

sentences.sContent: For low-income families, children’s safety equipment can be prohibitively expensive (= so expensive that most people cannot afford it ).
sentences.sCn: 对于低收入家庭来说，儿童的安全设备贵得让人望而却步。

sentences.sContent: Employing the wrong builder can be a horribly expensive mistake.
sentences.sCn: 用错建筑工人有时会是代价高昂的错误。

sentences.sContent: Her husband had expensive tastes (= liked expensive things ).
sentences.sCn: 她丈夫喜欢的东西都很贵。

sentences.sContent: ...which probably reflects how these types of products are typically more expensive than regular toilet paper...
...A friend recently took her mother to visit an expensive assisted living/nursing home near my town...
...the company may still be cursing its decision to promote cheap choices over more expensive ones because items on its "value menu" now account for around 20% of all sales...
...hoping that once they had tempted customers through the door they would be persuaded to order more expensive items...
...fast-food chains have weathered the recession better than their more expensive competitors...
...It’s a very expensive camera you know...
...hiring someone to take care of them while you go to work is getting more expensive by the year...
...That lets us avoid building costly plants or buying expensive power at peak usage time...
...for other students who don’t have such a luxury it’s an added layer of cost — and an expensive one at that...
...Have they become somehow massively more expensive to educate...
